title: Hospital patients paying up to 70 times more than prisoners to watch television
text:

Hospital patients could pay up to 70 times more to watch television than convicted criminals behind bars. 
Inmates pay just £1 per week to watch television compared with hospital patients who can pay anything between £15 and £70. 
The Liverpool Echo reports in Merseyside bedside TV in Southport and Formby Hospital costs £10 per day, with the option to add Sky Sports on for a further £10 charge. 
The television sets are provided and operated by Hospedia and feature live TV across five channels. 
Asked about the high costs being levied on hospital patients, a spokesperson from Hospedia said: “The point is that we are a commercial business with costs to maintain the systems and provide services to bed units. Read More HMP Liverpool inmates are charged £1 per week (Photo: Daily Mirror) Whereas nearby hospital patients have to pay up to £70 a week (Photo: Southport Visiter) 
“With that we do offer lot of free services - we provide free radio 24/7, free calls to land lands and we are piloting free calls to mobile phones. 
“We offer free TV at different times of the day, so there are free opportunities to use the service. 
“We are a commercial business with costs to maintain the units, we are not paid by the NHS.” Read More Killer caught using TINDER behind bars after victim's sister sets trap 
A document produced by the Ministry of Justice on “incentives and earned privileges” for inmates states that all prisons are required to recover £1 per week from prisoners as a rental charge for each TV set. 
The charge on inmates at HMP Liverpool is per set, not per prisoner, and comes out of an individual’s spends account. 
Prisoners can enjpy nine free-to-view channels, including BBC, ITV, Channel 4 and Film 4, although governors may change this selection locally. 
A spokesperson from Southport and Ormskirk Hospital Trust said: “A Trust spokesman said: “Bedside TV, telephone and multi-media services are provided by our partner Hospedia. The Trust receives no income from the service.” Like us on Facebook
